Class TicTacToe

java.lang.Object
dev.bjdelacruz.tictactoe.TicTacToe
public final class TicTacToe extends Object
This class is responsible for creating a new Tic-Tac-Toe grid, creating players for the game, and marking spots on the grid for both players. It is also responsible for checking whether a player won or the game ended in a tie.

  • Method Details

    • createNewClassicGame

      public static TicTacToe createNewClassicGame()
      Creates a new Tic-Tac-Toe grid with size 3x3.
      Returns:
      A new Tic-Tac-Toe game.

    • createComputerPlayer

      public static Player createComputerPlayer(TicTacToe game)
      Creates a new player that represents the computer and can only be used in a person-vs-computer game.
      Parameters:
      game - This game.
      Returns:
      An instance of a Player representing the computer.

    • createHumanPlayer

      public static Player createHumanPlayer(TicTacToe game)
      Creates a new player that represents a human being and can be used in a person-vs-computer or person-vs-person game.
      Parameters:
      game - This game.
      Returns:
      An instance of a Player representing a human player.

    • isTie

      public boolean isTie()
      Returns true if players cannot make any more moves and there is no winner.
      Returns:
      True if the game ends in a tie, false otherwise.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Returns true if a player won or the game ended in a tie.
      Returns:
      True if a player won or there are no more moves to make, false otherwise.

    • getWinner

      public Optional<Player> getWinner()
      Returns the player who won the game. An empty Optional is returned if no one won yet or the game ended in a tie.
      Returns:
      The player who makes the winning move.

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(Player player1, Player player2)
      Sets the two players who will be playing this game. Only one player can be a computer player. The game can start after this method is called.
      Parameters:
      player1 - The first player.
      player2 - The second player.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if both players are a computer player or both players use the same marks.

    • mark

      public boolean mark(int row, int column)
      Marks a spot on the grid at the given row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row in the grid, 1 <= row <= grid size
      column - The row in the grid, 1 <= column <= grid size
      Returns:
      True if a spot was successfully marked on the grid, false otherwise (e.g. the player did not make a move because the spot was already marked by the other player).

    • getMarkAt

      public String getMarkAt(int row, int column)
      Returns the mark at the given row and column in the grid.
      Parameters:
      row - The row in the grid, 1 <= row <= grid size
      column - The column in the grid, 1 <= column <= grid size
      Returns:
      The player's mark at the given row and column, or an empty string if no one marked that spot.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if row or column is less than 1 or greater than the size of the grid.

    • getState

      public String getState()
      Returns a string representation of the current state of this game.
      Returns:
      A string representing the current state of this game, or an empty string if the game has not started.

    • restoreState

      public void restoreState(String state)
      Restores a game to the given saved state. Call getCurrentPlayer() to find out whose turn it is to make a move after this method returns. This method does nothing if state is null or an empty string.
      Parameters:
      state - The saved state of a game.

    • continueGame

      public void continueGame()
      Continues the game after its state has been restored by restoreState(String). This method does nothing if any of the following is true:
      • the game is played in player-versus-player mode
      • the current player is the computer after a player has made a turn
      • the current player is not the computer

    • getFirstPlayer

      public String getFirstPlayer()
      Returns the name of the player who made the first move in this game.
      Returns:
      The name of the player who moved first, or an empty string if the game has not started.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public String getCurrentPlayer()
      Returns the name of the player whose turn it is to mark a spot on the grid.
      Returns:
      The name of the current player, or an empty string if the game has not started.

    • getGrid

      public String getGrid()
      Returns a square grid showing the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      A square grid that shows the current state of the game.
